item.title: TIL: How to prevent a package from updating on ubuntu
item.description: Sometimes you need to upgrade a server, but you also need to prevent apt from upgrading a specific package (eg. your node.js version). Many package-managers support this scenario under names like “version pinning” or “package holding”. This is how you prevent apt from upgrading a single package: Dependencies Ubuntu 12.04 or newer apt Pin a package to prevent it from being upgraded sudo apt-mark hold $PACKAGE_NAME Pin a package to prevent it from being upgraded sudo apt-mark unhold $PACKAGE_NAME
